channel.title: LogIn
channel.description: Why can't i play My server on my other computer? is there any way i can do that?

item.title: LogIn
item.dc:creator: @Tobbescape Tobbescape
item.description:
@Tobbescape wrote:

Okay, if you go to “cmd” type in ipconfig /all, then you look for the ipv4 address, you have to use that to connect, or just restart your router… I had the problem myself.

Read full topic

item.title: LogIn
item.dc:creator: @Tobbescape Tobbescape
item.description:
@Tobbescape wrote:

[quote=“d_thaosta@hotmail.com, post:6, topic:440876”]it starts correctly, it opens everything. but when i log in an account it says error connection to server. i tried the Jar client i sent to people and the jar client that i am using which is local because i have to use it to play my own server. but none seems to work

And @sebblol i already know you have to log in as your local host. i’m not talking about that. i’m saying why can’t i log in on other computers around my house even if i use the client i sent people and my original client… i can log in on my server on my main host computer… but not on any other computers around my house.[/quote]
Do you log in localhost on your main computer?

Read full topic

item.title: LogIn
item.dc:creator: @d_thaosta d_thaosta@hotmail.com
item.description:
@d_thaosta wrote:

it starts correctly, it opens everything. but when i log in an account it says error connection to server. i tried the Jar client i sent to people and the jar client that i am using which is local because i have to use it to play my own server. but none seems to work

And @sebblol i already know you have to log in as your local host. i’m not talking about that. i’m saying why can’t i log in on other computers around my house even if i use the client i sent people and my original client… i can log in on my server on my main host computer… but not on any other computers around my house.

Read full topic

item.title: LogIn
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

sebblol:

Some servers you must login to at 127.0.0.1 even if other can login at your ip idk why

That’s localhost…
Don’t listen tot his moron, Do you mean that your client won’t start correctly?

Read full topic

item.title: LogIn
item.dc:creator: @d_thaosta d_thaosta@hotmail.com
item.description:
@d_thaosta wrote:

my server is up and running, as many other friends are already in. when i double screen it works. i can’t seem to use it on my other computer when i sent my client. Portfowarding is correctly already.

Read full topic

item.title: LogIn
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

maybe because you haven’t portforwarded right? or haven’t change the ip in the client, and the source may only allow one ip to login per connection

Read full topic
